title: iszo
author: iszo
content: Hey everyoneI’m considering starting SPREADBTC.ORG, a space designed to help get Bitcoin into as many hands as possible. The idea is to build an open, transparent, and collaborative platform for people who already know the basics of Bitcoin but want to focus on pushing adoption further. This means:    Forums where we can share strategies on introducing Bitcoin to new communities, businesses, or regions.    Community Proposals, where we can pitch initiatives or projects that could benefit from extra support or funding—possibly from “whales” who’d like to help.    Transparency in all decisions, especially around financial backing, so everyone understands each step we take.I’ve already made some progress on how this could look, but these are just the basics. If you like the concept, I can share more details about the idea and the roadmap I have in mind.Would SPREADBTC.ORG be helpful? If you’re down to help or have suggestions, I’d love to hear them. Thanks for reading, and I’m excited to see what y'all think!

comments.author: apogio
comments.body: Good idea, but it's not an initiative.There are literally hundreds (perhaps thousands) of websites that concentrate this type of info.One simple example is https://bitcoin-only.com/You can find communities, forums, wallets, software, hardware, merch, jobs, etc.

comments.author: iszo
comments.body: You’re right, there are many similar initiatives, though bitcoin-only.com is more like a guide than what I have in mind. This idea needs more people on board to really stand out. I’m not aiming small, I know it won’t be easy but we have to spread bitcoin.I'm open to new ideas and developing the project. Right now, there's nothing to lose except taking the time to discuss possibilities so it's worth the try imo.As they say, we should take advantage of the "momentum" we are getting.

comments.author: iszo
comments.body: So, what I’m aiming for with it is a community driven, forum-style platform that goes beyond just sharing information. I want it to function like an organization, where everyone moves together, analyzing the best ways to spread Bitcoin globally. It should be interactive and responsive, a place where people can post ideas, work on projects together, and discuss ways to push adoption further, like helping businesses accept BTC, launching local initiatives, or increasing awareness in new ways.If “whales” or larger contributors decide to get involved, I want everything to be transparent so everyone sees exactly how support or funding is used. I’m still refining the core idea, so I don’t have final designs or links to share yet. But once I do, I’ll definitely include them for a clearer picture.
